etymologies: Old English stede ‘place’, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch stad ‘town’, German Statt ‘place’, Stadt ‘town’, from an Indo-European root shared by the verb stand

definitions: the place or role that someone or something should have or fill (used in referring to a substitute)

examples.text: you wish to have him superseded and to be appointed in his stead

shortDefinitions: place or role that person or thing should have or fill
